instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPSUB_G3H: What is PPSUB_G3H? This is a typo of PPBUS_G3H When you see PPSUB_G3H, assume they meant to type PPBUS_G3H.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>PPSUB_G3H</SIGNAL> shorted ground
threads.message:
Hello everybody

I m working on liquid damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board. Some one cleaned board, cant see burned items or corrosion. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is shorted ground when i inject voltage <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> line after remove F7140 no where worming up:( checked every place board for any hot parts nothing. 

Note: Checked usb ,thunderbolt  and all connectors on board for damaged pins or like that.

What can i do next step?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>PPSUB_G3H</SIGNAL> shorted ground
threads.message: Measure on diode mode from pin 2 from F7140 to all big coils, no one should give you a low value or beep.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>PPSUB_G3H</SIGNAL> shorted ground
threads.message: Yes there will be low resistance to the CPU Vcore coils. Measure F7140 to L7320, probably shorted and if so it will have taken out the CPU most likely.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>PPSUB_G3H</SIGNAL> shorted ground
threads.message:
Thanks Duke after replace <TRANSISTOR>Q7310</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7311</TRANSISTOR> shortcut was gone. But now when plug magsafe machine not power on. only usb mouse led flash one second and dead. Magsafe led is first green after orange

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 12.5V
<SIGNAL>PP3V42V_G3H</SIGNAL> - 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3_PCH</SIGNAL> - 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> - 5V
<SIGNAL>PP3V_S5</SIGNAL> - 3V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>PPSUB_G3H</SIGNAL> shorted ground
threads.message: Most likely a dead CPU.... What is the resistance from L7320 to ground???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>PPSUB_G3H</SIGNAL> shorted ground
threads.message: Yeah if it was shorted the CPU will be dead, end of the line.
